headline: Is Southwest’s Bold Shift To Assigned Seating And Perks Altering The Investment Case For LUV?
summary: Southwest Airlines recently reported past-quarter operating income growth above 40% and outlined what it calls the most ambitious transformation in its history, including assigned seating, extra legroom options, expanded online distribution, and free Wi‑Fi for Rapid Rewards members. Alongside returning US$2.90 billion to shareholders in 2025, Southwest has attracted strong analyst enthusiasm even as Elliott Investment Management trimmed its stake after a very large share price rise. Now,...

headline: A Look At Southwest Airlines (LUV) Valuation As Its Overhaul And 2026 Guidance Boost Investor Confidence
summary: Southwest Airlines (LUV) is back in focus after a wide ranging overhaul that includes assigned seating with extra legroom, free Wi-Fi for Rapid Rewards members, and 2026 earnings guidance alongside higher operating income. See our latest analysis for Southwest Airlines. headline: Billionaire Paul Singer Just Trimmed Southwest Airlines Holding After A 75% Gain — What Does He See Now?
summary: Billionaire hedge fund investor Paul Singer just began cashing in on one of his biggest winning bets: Southwest Airlines Co. (NYSE:LUV). Singer's hedge fund, Elliott Investment Management, sold roughly 5.3 million shares of the low-cost carrier, trimming its massive position as the stock trades nearly 75% above Elliott's average buy price of about $29.10, according to a Schedule 13D filed on Feb. 23. Even after the sale, Elliott still holds about 45 million shares. Southwest is now one of the fu
